summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. The GetCurrentActualFrameRate method retrieves the actual frame rate, expressed as a frame duration in 100-nanosecond units. USB (Universal Serial Bus) and IEEE 1394 cameras may provide lower frame rates than requested because of bandwidth availability. This is only available during video streaming.

member.param: Pointer to the pin to retrieve the frame rate from.
Pointer to the frame rate in frame duration in 100-nanosecond units.
member.returns: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

The GetMaxAvailableFrameRate method retrieves the maximum frame rate currently available, based on bus bandwidth usage for connections, such as USB and IEEE 1394, where the maximum frame rate may be limited by bandwidth availability.

member.param: Pointer to the pin to retrieve the maximum frame rate from.

Index of the format to query for maximum frame rate. This index corresponds to the order in which formats are enumerated by . The value must range between zero and the number of supported VIDEO_STREAM_CONFIG_CAPS structures returned by ) minus one.
Frame image size (width and height) in pixels.
Pointer to the maximum available frame rate. The frame rate is expressed as frame duration in 100-nanosecond units.
member.returns: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.
